III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention Standards and Prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 07/09/2023, youth physically assaulted a staff member and
attempted to take the staff member's keys. While restraining
youth, staff member bit youth's finger and pushed her head into
the ground. Youth sustained a dime sized abrasion on the left side
of her forehead. She did not have a visible bite mark.
Investigation Interviews:
Administrator 1/ Complaint Source was interviewed via phone
on July 10, 2023. Administrator 1 reported Staff 1 called her the
night of 07/09/2023 after Youth A reported the complaint and
Administrator 1 completed proper reporting. Administrator 1 was
not present when the restraint occurred.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 10,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported
on July 9, 2023, there was a fight between Youth B and Youth E
outside of the unit. She reported she wanted to go outside as a
coping skill but wasn’t being allowed due to not being on the
appropriate level on the unit. Youth A reported she ran out of the
unit when Staff 3 was taking Youth B off the unit to cool down.
She reported Staff 3 was able to stop her and escorted her back
into the unit. Youth A reported she met Staff 1 when she got into
the door and Staff 1 grabbed her and then pushed her down to the
ground. Youth A reported Staff 1 was laying on top of her while
she was on the ground and Youth A was trying to hit Staff 1 to get
her off her. She reported when she went to hit Staff 1 with her
hand, Staff 1 bit her finger. Youth A reported her head was on the
ground during this time and that is how she got the mark on her
head, which was noted to be seen within the interview. Youth A
had a small dime size abrasion on the left side of her head near
her hairline, and marks under her chin and on her arm. There was
no bite mark seen on her finger. Youth A reported she was able to
be seen by Nurse today.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 12,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Administrator 2
2

was present for the interview. Staff 1 reported she has been
working at the facility for about 9 years. She reported the staff are
frequently trained on the restraint model and she feels well
equipped to perform a restraint. Staff 1 reported when she arrived
on shift, on July 9, 2023, there was a physical fight that occurred
with Youth B and Youth E. Youth E had been taken off the unit
and Youth B was in a negative headspace that spread throughout
the rest of the unit. She reported Youth B was talking with Youth A
about how they needed to beat up Youth E. Staff 1 reported Youth
A had asked to go to her room and changed her clothes. She
reported all the youth on the unit continued to be redirected on
shift about whispering and talking negatively. She reported Staff 1
and herself attempted to have a house meeting to talk about the
negative headspace, participate in different activities to divert the
negative attitudes and put calming music on. Staff 1 reported the
all youth on the unit did not respond well to that, so the plan was
to have Staff 3 take Youth B off the unit to help calm her down.
She reported when Staff 3 opened the door, Youth A was able to
grab the door and Youth A and Youth D ran off the unit. Staff 1
reported Staff 3 was able to escort Youth A back into the unit and
she immediately shut the door so Youth A could not get back out.
She reported Youth A was still escalated and punched Staff 1 in
the head twice. Staff 1 reported she attempted to initiate a
restraint hold on Youth A with Staff 2 but Youth A ended up losing
her balance and fell face first on the ground. This is how the mark
on her upper left forehead occurred. Staff 1 ended up falling as
well since Staff 1 tripped over Youth A’s legs. Staff 1 reported she
immediately repositioned her legs to be beside Youth A's body.
She reported Youth A continued to swing at her and punched her
in the mouth while on the ground. Staff 1 reported she and Staff 2
continued to hold Youth A’s arms to get her into a seated position.
Youth A was focused on grabbing Staff 1’s keys. Staff 1 reported
her keys went flying out of her pocket when she fell on the ground.
Staff 1 reported she completed a grip release on Youth A’s hand
to get the keys while Staff 2 grabbed the keys from the other side
of Youth A. She reported they were able to get Youth A on her
feet in a two-person hold. She reported Staff 4 came for support
and escorted Youth A off the unit. Staff 1 reported she never had
her body on top of Youth A and never bit her. She reported Youth
A attempted to bite her at one point. She reported she and Staff 2
always had their knees and feet on the ground when getting Youth
A into a seated position with her hands behind her back in a two-
person control hold. She reported when Youth A was in a seated
position was when Youth A was telling Staff 1 and Staff 2 she
couldn’t breathe because she wanted to be released. Staff 1
reported her airway passages were checked and there was no
3

concern. She reported the whole situation was less than three
minutes.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 12,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Administrator 2
was present for the interview. Staff 2 reported she started
working at the facility about two months ago and feels that she
has been fully trained in policies and restraint training. She
reported she completed an eight-hour training on the restraint
model and had to physically perform the restraints to pass the
class. Staff 2 reported she was working on July 9, 2023, with Staff
1 and Staff 3. She reported when she arrived to work Youth B was
in an escalated state because of a fight she got into with Youth E.
Staff 2 reported this created Youth A to be in a negative
headspace since she is a follower of Youth B. She reported she
tried to calm down the negative energy in the unit as they had a
house meeting with the youth about how to handle their emotions
and redirect the energy. Staff 2 reported after the meeting Youth A
had asked for her to let her into her room to get a jacket because
she was cold. Staff 2 reported when Youth A came out of her
room, she had changed her outfit completely and put her hair up
looking like she was ready to fight someone. She reported Youth
A continued to talk with Youth B and Youth D about how she was
ready to fight someone. To help calm the situation more it was
decided that Staff 3 would take Youth B off the unit to calm down.
When Staff 3 attempted to leave, Youth A and Youth D caught the
door and ran out of the room. Staff 2 reported she was focused on
Youth D at this time since she was on higher precaution level due
to self-harm behaviors. She reported she ran out the door for the
moment to keep an eye on Youth D and Staff 3 was able to escort
Youth A back into the unit. She reported when Youth A was
escorted back into the unit, Staff 2 was already back in the unit
and Staff 1 was by the door. When Youth A was escorted to the
unit, Staff 1 closed the door immediately and Staff 3 stayed out in
the hallway with Youth B and Youth D. Staff 2 reported Youth A
came into the room fighting Staff 1 and swinging her arms. Staff 2
reported Youth A punched Staff 1 in the face and a restraint was
attempted due to Youth A’s assaultive behavior. She reported she
saw Youth A try to punch Staff 1 again and lost her balance and
fell face-first onto the ground. Staff 2 then saw Staff 1 trip over
Youth A’s legs and fell to the floor. She reported she saw Staff 1
fall on top of Youth A’s legs but Staff 1 repositioned herself so that
she was beside her. She reported when Youth A was on the
ground Staff 1 and Staff 2 attempted to do a two-person assist to
get Youth A into a two-person seated position. Staff 2 reported
Youth A continued to resist and kept moving her arms around to
4

try to hurt staff. When Staff 1 fell, her keys went flying and Youth A
was able to get a hold of the keys. Staff 2 reported Youth A was
laying on the ground at this time and she was on Youth A’s side
trying to get her into a seated hold with Staff 1. To get the keys out
of Youth A’s hand Staff 2 reported she put her knee up near Youth
A’s head while a grip release occurred to get the keys out of Youth
A’s opposite hand. Once the keys were in Staff 2’s possession,
Youth A grabbed Staff 2’s hair and continued to try to attack her.
Staff 2 reported she and Staff 1 continued to attempt to get Youth
A into a seated position. Once she was up, Staff 4 arrived on the
unit and was able to get Youth A escorted off the unit. Staff 2
reported Staff 1 never pushed Youth A onto the ground and Youth
A lost her balance when she was assaulting staff. She reported
she never heard or saw Staff 1 bite Youth A and noted Youth A
did punch Staff 1 in the mouth. Staff 2 reported this whole
situation lasted no more than three minutes.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 12,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported he
worked on July 9, 2023, and was involved with Youth B being in a
physical fight with Youth E earlier in the day. He reported when
Youth B was brought back to the unit, she remained in an
escalated state which ramped up the other youth. Staff 3 reported
after speaking with Staff 1 and Staff 2 the plan was to keep the
youth separated to eliminate the escalated behavior. He reported
he planned to bring Youth B off the unit and down to the
classroom area in the building to chill out. When he was leaving
the unit, Youth A and Youth D caught the door and ran down the
hallway. Staff 3 reported he was able to escort Youth A back into
the unit and continued to monitor Youth B and Youth D that were
in the hallway. He reported he did not see Youth A restrained on
the unit by Staff 1 or Staff 2. Staff 3 reported the team is trained in
the AEGIS restraint model and a restraint is only used when a
youth is a harm to themselves or others.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on July 14, 2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported he has
worked at the facility for about three years. He reported on July 9,
2023, he was working on another unit but heard some commotion
in the hallway. He reported he saw Staff 3 out in the hallway with
Youth B and Youth D who were continuing to bang on the unit
door. Staff 4 reported Staff 3 was trying to calm the situation
down. There was a phone call from the unit stating support was
needed with Youth A. Staff 4 reported he looked into the unit from
the window in the door and saw two staff members struggling with
two different youth. He reported when he first walked up to the
5

door, he heard a staff member say, “She bite me,” but does not
know who that was coming from. He reported he did not know the
staff members' names that were working on the unit. Staff 2
reported he saw Youth A pulling a staff member’s hair and Youth
A targeting staff. He stated when get got onto the unit Youth A
was not lying on the ground and never saw any staff lay their body
on Youth A. He stated he went into a two-person standing hold
with the other staff member whose hair was not getting pulled and
then he went into a one-person standing hold with Youth A. Staff 4
reported he just went through re-certification of restraint training
so everything was still fresh on his mind. He reported he was able
to get Youth A off the unit and was able to process with her after
some space was given. Staff 4 reported Youth A was escorted
into the hallway towards the classroom area. He reported he
knows Youth A as he has worked with her at his other job at Youth
A’s school, so he has a decent relationship with her. He reported
Youth A reported a staff laid on her. Staff 4 reported he never saw
any staff push Youth A or lay on her. He reported Youth A was not
on the ground when he arrived and he saw Youth A attacking
staff.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 12,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported
on July 9, 2023, she had gotten into a physical fight with Youth E
on the unit when they were outside. Youth E was kept separated
from her and Youth B was brought back to the unit. Youth B
reported she was still in an escalated state when she came back
to the unit and was getting annoyed with staff. She reported Youth
A likes to mimic her all the time and during this time Youth A
started to follow her escalated attitude. Youth B reported Youth A
began to swear and yell at the staff. She reported Staff 1 tried to
divide up the unit to keep everyone calm and it was determined
Staff 3 would take Youth B off the unit to calm down. Youth B
reported when she was trying to leave the unit with Staff 3, Youth
A and Youth D caught the door open and ran off. She reported
Youth D ran towards the end of the main hallway and Youth A was
caught by Staff 3. She reported Staff 3 escorted Youth A back to
the unit and Youth B and Youth D remained off the unit with Staff
3. Youth B reported she heard Youth A making a scene on the
unit and she looked into the window of the door and saw Staff 1
laying on top of Youth A trying to restrain her. She reported she
did not see how Youth A got onto the ground. Youth B reported
Staff 1 should have not been laying on top of Youth A
. She reported later on she heard from Youth A that Staff 1 bit her
as well. Youth B reported she has never been restrained like that.
6

Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 12,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth C reported
she was sitting in the milieu when Youth A was getting restrained
by Staff 1 and Staff 2. She reported she was not paying attention
to the situation and did not see Youth A get thrown to the ground.
Youth C reported due to her past trauma of abuse she blacked out
the situation and does not remember much. She stated Youth A
was getting restrained because Youth A had hit Staff 1 in the face
and was escalated. Youth C reported she saw Staff 1 lying half of
her body on top of Youth A’s body for a short period of time. She
reported she remembers hearing Youth A saying she could not
breathe so she went over to try to get Staff 2 off of her. Youth C
did not remember if Youth A was sitting up or laying on the ground
when she went over to help Youth A. She reported she grabbed
Staff 2 due to her trying to grab Youth A’s arms. Youth C reported
at the end she remembered Youth A getting escorted off the unit
by Staff 4 to take a break.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 12,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth D reported
on July 9, 2023, she followed along with Youth A when she ran off
the unit. She reported Staff 3 was able to bring Youth A back on
the unit, but Youth D stayed off the unit with Youth B and Staff 3.
Youth D reported she did not see Youth A get restrained as she
was in the hallway and not on the unit. She reported she did look
through the doorway window into the unit and saw Youth A had
her head on the ground. Youth D reported she heard from Youth B
that Staff 1 and Staff 2 were on top of her. She reported someone
from another unit came over for support and was able to get Youth
A off the unit to calm down.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on July
12, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor
reported she got to the unit after the situation had occurred. She
reported she spoke with Youth A who never had any medical
complaints until she was told Youth B was going to the hospital
due to her fighting Youth E prior and hurting her hand. Supervisor
reported nursing was contacted but there was no major medical
concern to bring her to the hospital. Supervisor reported when she
arrived Youth A was still escalated and breaking things on the
unit. She reported she was able to calm Youth A down. Supervisor
reported Youth A is a behavioral youth and on her first day at the
facility was threatening to fight other staff and youth. She reported
Youth A thrives off of the energy from the other youth and likes to
follow Youth B’s attitude. Supervisor reported she directly
7

supervises Staff 1 and Staff 2 and has no concern with the staff’s
ability to restrain or perform their job duties.
Conference call was held with MDHHS Worker on August 3,
2023. MDHHS worker reported there are no findings to their
investigation. MDHHS Worker reported they spoke with Law
Enforcement and reported there is pending assault charges
against Youth A but no charges against staff.
Documents Reviewed
- Wedgwood incident report dated 07/09/2023 completed
by Staff 1- This incident was consistent with the interview
from Staff 1 about the incidents leading up to the restraint
and action taken.
- Facility Nursing Note dated 07/10/2023-Nurse saw Youth
A on 07/10/2023 at 9:30am due to the incident that
occurred the night prior. Youth A had a minor abrasion to
her left temple with no active bleeding, signs of infection,
and no significant swelling. Youth A denied any headache
dizziness, blurred vision or nausea/vomiting. Nurse had
staff monitor Youth A for concussion. Nurse saw Youth A
again an hour later. Nurse noted there was multiple minor
scratches on the left side of her neck that appeared to be
all superficial and no signs of infection. When Nurse asked
Youth A how she got these scratches and she reported she
was restrained, and staff tried to strangle her. Nurse also
noted there was additional small scratch on Youth A’s left
hand between her 4th and 5th knuckle and one to her right
elbow. All scratches were healing well and showed no
signs of infection. Youth A had no complaints at the time of
this check in.
- Wedgwood’s Behavior Management Procedures-
Prohibited Techniques- Prohibited Behavior Management
Techniques at the facility includes corporal or physical
punishment including spanking, hitting, pinching, slapping,
or hair pulling. It also includes any behavior management
intervention found to produce adverse side effects such as
illness, severe emotional or physical stress, or physical
damage will be promptly discontinued. Staff must
continually monitor the client’s physical and emotional
condition and modify their intervention at any point where
the client appears at risk of being physically or
psychologically harmed.
8

- Wedgwood’s Behavior Management Procedures- Staff
are to first employ preventive and/or supportive behavior
management techniques, including a variety of de-
escalation approaches and activation of client self-control
plans. When an environment that is excessively controlled
by the staff is at risk for disruption and offers fewer
opportunities for youth to make choices and exercise the
responsibility of self-control. The treatment team should
develop skill and finesse in each of its members in sensing
when it’s time to step in, when to selectively ignore, and
when to encourage alternatives.
- Wedgwood Crisis Management Procedures- Physical
Management may only occur with a client whose behavior
is significantly dangerous to self or others. Physical
Management is performed according to the current
techniques of the “Aegis System”, Wedgwood’s approved
crisis intervention program. The use of force and duration
of restraint must be limited to that which is necessary to
ensure the optimal care, welfare, safety, and security of all.
Restraint techniques must never be used for punishment,
discipline, or retaliation.
- Human Resource File for Staff 1- Staff 1 has been
employed at the facility since 2014. She has disciplines for
lack of training hours, leaving a youth unsupervised,
inappropriate response to youth, and medication errors.
The last discipline was noted to be in early 2021. Per Staff
1’s training log she has completed the yearly refresher of
the facility’s Crisis Prevention and De-escalation training.
Her most recent recertification was dated 03/16/2023.
Analysis The facility is found to be in compliance as there was no evidence
found to support Staff 1 or Staff 2 pushed Youth A to the ground
or Staff 1 bit Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth Restraint; Pregnant Youth;
Section Reduction, Prevention; Prohibited restraints; Elimination
Description (2) The following restraints are strictly prohibited:
(e)Restraining youth in a prone position or any restraint that
restricts the youth’s airway.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Another staff member put her knee on the back of youth's neck
and youth could not breathe.
9

Investigation Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 10,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported
while she was being restrained on July 9, 2023, by Staff 1 and
Staff 2, Staff 2 had her knee in the back of her head, and she said
she couldn’t breathe. Youth A reported in order to get Staff 1 and
Staff 2 off of her she attempted to grab Staff 1’s keys that were
lying next to them. She reported she was then released and
escorted out of the room towards the hallway of the unit and was
given space near the classroom area. Youth A reported Staff 4
came to help give her space from Staff 1 and Staff 2.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 12,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Administrator 2
was present for the interview. Staff 1 reported Staff 2’s knee
was never on Youth’s A body at all, and Youth A was never in a
prone restraint. She reported Staff 2’s knee was near Youth A’s
head at one point to help grab the keys out of Youth A’s hand
when she had hold of the keys. She reported Youth A only yelled
she could not breathe when she was sitting fully up and there
were no staff body parts on the youth. Staff 1 reported Youth A’s
airways were continuously checked on in the situation and Youth
A reported no medical concerns after the restraint occurred.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 12,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Administrator 2
was present for the interview. Staff 2 reported she never put
her knee on the back of Youth A’s neck and never had her full
body on Youth A. She reported when Youth A was on the ground
and grabbed Staff 1’s keys she was on the opposite side of Youth
A’s hand that had Staff 1’s keys. She reported to help get Youth A
to release the keys, Staff 2 sat up and put one knee up in a
kneeling position near Youth A’s head to reach over to grab the
keys while Staff 1 did the grip release. She reported her knee was
never on part of Youth A’s body as it was on the ground. She
reported when Youth A fell she was facing into the unit. Staff 2
reported if someone was looking into the unit it would be hard for
them to get a clear picture of what they saw.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 12,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported he
did not witness Staff 1 and Staff 2 restrain Youth A on July 9,
2023, as he was in the hallway supervising Youth B and Youth D.
He reported staff should never put their knee on a youth as this
does not follow their approved restraint technique.
10

Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on July 14, 2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported he never
saw anyone put their knee or any body part of Youth A. He
reported he came over for support at the end of the situation.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 12,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported
on July 9, 2023, when she looked into the unit door she saw Staff
2’s knee on the back of Youth A’s head. Youth B reported this is
not supported to happen. She reported at the end of the situation
Staff 4 came into the unit and was able to escort Youth A off the
unit to de-escalate.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 12,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth C reported
she was in the milieu when Youth A was getting restrained by
Staff 1 and Staff 2 on July 9, 2023. She reported she remembered
she tried to pull Staff 2 off of Youth A. Youth C reported she heard
from Youth A that Staff 2’s knee was on Youth A’s head, but
Youth C reported she does not remember ever seeing that
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 12,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth D reported
she was off the unit when Youth A was getting restrained by Staff
1 and Staff 2. She reported she did look into the door’s window
and saw Youth A’s head was on the around. Youth D reported she
did not see Staff 2’s knee on Youth A’s head.
Documents Reviewed
- Wedgwood Crisis Management Procedures- Physical
Management may only occur with a client whose behavior
is significantly dangerous to self or others. Physical
Management is performed according to the current
techniques of the “Aegis System”, Wedgwood’s approved
crisis intervention program. The use of force and duration
of restraint must be limited to that which is necessary to
ensure the optimal care, welfare, safety, and security of all.
- Wedgwood’s Behavior Management Procedures-
Prohibited Techniques- Restraint interventions
specifically prohibited according to MDHHS regulations
includes: Prone position (face down on floor) and placing
upright clients face first directly against a wall. Staff are
prohibited to do any behavior management intervention
found to produce adverse side effects such as illness,
severe emotional or physical stress, or physical damage
11

will be promptly discontinued. Staff must continually
monitor the client’s physical and emotional condition and
modify their intervention at any point where the client
appears at risk of being physically or psychologically
harmed.
- Human Resource File for Staff 2- Staff 2 was hired in
April 2023. There is no disciplinary actions noted within her
personnel file. Staff 2 completed the Intro to Crisis
Prevention and De-escalation training on 05/03/2023,
which indicates she was trained on the facility’s restraint
model and policy.
Analysis The facility is found to be in compliance as during interviews with
staff and youth, Staff 2 did not place her knee on Youth A’s head
or neck. Staff 2 did have her knee next to Youth A’s head and she
assisted in a grip release.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
